review.title: Sampling High Throughput Data for Anomaly Detection of Data-Base Activity
review.abstract: Data leakage and theft from databases is a dangerous threat to organizations. Data Security and Data Privacy protection systems (DSDP) monitor data access and usage to identify leakage or suspicious activities that should be investigated. Because of the high velocity nature of database systems, such systems audit only a portion of the vast number of transactions that take place. Anomalies are investigated by a Security Officer (SO) in order to choose the proper response. In this paper we investigate the effect of sampling methods based on the risk the transaction poses and propose a new method for "combined sampling" for capturing a more varied sample.

sections.heading: 3.1 Data creation
sections.text: We present the user as a Gaussian distribution that produces a series of observations; an anomaly is created by selecting a data point that comes from a distribution other than that of the user; we created 1,000 users and for each user a set of observations; the observations generated contained 1% anomalies, an observation observed by another Gaussian; we added a new feature to the data - a risk designation that was randomly and independently generated for each observation; and 30% of the observations were classified as risky.

sections.heading: 3.2 Anomaly detection
sections.text: We simulated the following anomalies of the information system for each user: (1) Each observation can be evaluated for testing. (2) When sampled, it is compared to the previous set of sampled observations. (3) The user's method is estimated on the basis of mean and standard deviation. (4) An observation is characterized as an anomaly by the sham system if the observation value difference from the user's mean is greater than three standard deviations. Each sampling method was applied three times with different random seeds, and the results were averaged. We sampled in four proportions: 35%, 30%, 25%, and 20%. Sampling of the individual classes in the "combination method" was set at 80% for the risky class and 20% for the non-risky class 4.
